title: PRODUCT COMPOSITION
description:
PRODUCT COMPOSITION contains minimal and/or maximal measurable amounts of INGREDIENTs of a DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.
The PRODUCT COMPOSITION has an Intended DOSE FORM, but it lacks any PHYSICAL APPEARANCE description. The PHYSICAL APPEARANCE is provided for the fully formulated DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION.
------
A PRODUCT COMPOSITION is the qualitative and quantitative composition of a DRUG PRODUCT.Â 
[Source: CPD3 Training Lesson D05: Product Information - Product Compositions]

id.title: productCompositionId
id.description: Unique identifier of the object PRODUCT COMPOSITION. Often called PCID.

targetQuantity.title: targetQuantity
targetQuantity.description: The Target Quantity is the amount of DRUG PRODUCT FOR CONFIGURATION for which the PRODUCT COMPOSITION is defined. The Target Quantity UoM is a separate attribute.

alternateMeasureQuantities.title: alternateTargetQuantitiesOfMeasure
alternateMeasureQuantities.description:
An ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY measured in the Alternate UNIT OF MEASURE (UoM) or Alternate UNIT OF PRESENTATION (UoP) specifies the same amount as the Target Quantity measured in the UNIT OF MEASURE: Quantity 1 [UoM] = Quantity 2 [Alternate UoM].
One ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY has either an Alternate UoM or an Alternate UoP (see constraint XOR):
1.	The ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY has a UoM, if the ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY is not countable, but only measurable by weight (e.g. powder) or volume (e.g. liquid). 
2.	If the ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY is countable, it may use the UoM Eaches (or Pieces) or it may specify this UoM in a UoP (e.g. tablet, suppository).

This object should have been more generally named ALTERNATE UoM CONVERSION. The conversion rule Quantity 1 [UoM] = Quantity 2 [Alternate UoM] can be rearranged to calculate a conversion factor: 1 [UoM] = (Quantity 2 / Quantity 1) [Alternate UoM].
Quantity 2 is the conversion factor numerator; here called Alternate Target Quantity.
Quantity 1 is the conversion factor denominator; here called denominator, not Target Quantity.
The Alternate Target Quantity UoM or UoP are attributes of this object.
The Target Quantity UoM is an attribute of the object "PRODUCT COMPOSITION".

alternatePresentationQuantities.title: alternateTargetQuantitiesOfPresentation
alternatePresentationQuantities.description:
An ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY measured in the Alternate UNIT OF MEASURE (UoM) or Alternate UNIT OF PRESENTATION (UoP) specifies the same amount as the Target Quantity measured in the UNIT OF MEASURE: Quantity 1 [UoM] = Quantity 2 [Alternate UoM].
One ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY has either an Alternate UoM or an Alternate UoP (see constraint XOR):
1.	The ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY has a UoM, if the ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY is not countable, but only measurable by weight (e.g. powder) or volume (e.g. liquid). 
2.	If the ALTERNATE TARGET QUANTITY is countable, it may use the UoM Eaches (or Pieces) or it may specify this UoM in a UoP (e.g. tablet, suppository).

This object should have been more generally named ALTERNATE UoM CONVERSION. The conversion rule Quantity 1 [UoM] = Quantity 2 [Alternate UoM] can be rearranged to calculate a conversion factor: 1 [UoM] = (Quantity 2 / Quantity 1) [Alternate UoM].
Quantity 2 is the conversion factor numerator; here called Alternate Target Quantity.
Quantity 1 is the conversion factor denominator; here called denominator, not Target Quantity.
The Alternate Target Quantity UoM or UoP are attributes of this object.
The Target Quantity UoM is an attribute of the object "PRODUCT COMPOSITION".

globalProductIds.title: globalProducts
globalProductIds.description:
The GLOBAL PRODUCT is the GLOBAL BRAND Name + Strength + Dose Form. It documents the Strengths and Dose Form combinations that BI has in its portfolio for the referenced GLOBAL BRAND.
With this, the GLOBAL PRODUCT is the "mother in headquarters" of all LOCAL PRODUCTs referencing (via the LOCAL BRAND) the same GLOBAL BRAND.
For GLOBAL BRANDs of PRODUCT CATEGORY immunological the Strength is documented in the GLOBAL PRODUCT, but not displayed in the GLOBAL PRODUCT Name.

items.title: globalProductId
items.description: Unique identifier of the object GLOBAL PRODUCT.

applicationCriteriums.title: applicationCriteriums
applicationCriteriums.description: The TEXT is any human readible text. It may be unstructured data ("free text") or it may be generated from structured data ("auto text"). It may have different maximum length. It may occur in different LANGUAGEs and WRITING SYSTEMs.

ingredients.title: ingredients
ingredients.description:
INGREDIENT is a SPECIFIED SUBSTANCE which plays a role in the PRODUCT COMPOSITION of a DRUG PRODUCT. This role may be Active Ingredient, Excipient, Adjuvant, Inactivant, Preservative, Impurity etc. 
The strength of the INGREDIENT is provided, and for active ingredients a strength of the REFERENCE SUBSTANCE may be provided.

authorityProduct.title: authorityProductCode
authorityProduct.description:
The AUTHORITY PRODUCT CODE is a product code provided by a HEALTH AUTHORITY for the identification of a medicinal product in the respective JURISDICTION. The AUTHORITY PRODUCT CODE may be used for identification of a medicinal product during (partial) manufacturing in a JURISDICTION and therefore is generally independent of any MAKETING AUTHORIZATION Number.
The AUHORITY PRODUCT CODE is provided by a HEALTH AUTHORITY and therefore maintained in the Registration Information Management (RIM) system. It is maintained at the PRODUCT COMPOSITION, COMBINED PRODUCT COMPOSITION and/or VALENCE PRODUCT COMPOSITION, respectively.

globalProductId.title: globalProduct.globalProductId
globalProductId.description:
This field is deprecated and will be removed soon.
Use productCompositionGlobalProductIDs instead.

Unique identifier of the object GLOBAL PRODUCT.

prevailingId.title: prevailingId
prevailingId.description:
One PRODUCT COMPOSITION must have a Prevailing ID if its GLOBAL LIFECYCLE STATUS is set to 99, duplicate (1). Otherwise the Prevailing ID remains empty (0).
This directs the user to the prevailing PRODUCT COMPOSITION.
